text:
_StringFromFile takes 4 arguments, and only 2 are documented.

Still, I tried multiple combinations (not adding any of the parameters, using 1
and 9999 respectively, ...) and none of them worked.

This function and its documentation should be thoroughly reviewed.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com

text:
Oops!

I updated the function to allow the file name to be chosen from a list of 
numbered files, but forgot to update the docs (and I'm not sure that I finished 
the enhancement).

AFAIK, the function works OK with 1 or 2 parameters - it is just the additional 
parameters that are undocumented (and possibly incompletely handled).

I'll fix this shortly...
creator: sebb@apache.org
sebb@apache.org
text:
Parameters 3 & 4 are start and end sequence; if used, the current sequence 
number is passed as parameter to DecimalFormat, where the format is the 
pathname.

e.g. pin#.dat could become pin7.dat.

I don't remember testing counts above 9, so I'll do that shortly ...

If the format does not have any formatting characters, then the output name 
will be the same as the input, but the file will only be used end-start+1 times.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Documentation has been updated. Leaving open until unit tests created (and 
verified).

creator: sebb@apache.org
text: Think this is all fixed now
